title: What Are the Symptoms of Pelvic Inflammatory Disease?
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: Pelvic inflammatory disease , or PID, is an infection of the organs of a women’s reproductive system. They include the uterus, ovaries , fallopian tubes, pelvic and abdominal cavities, and cervix . It’s usually caused by a sexually transmitted infection (STI), like chlamydia or gonorrhea , and is treated with antibiotics .
You might not notice any symptoms of PID early on. But as the infection gets worse, you can have:
Call your doctor right away if you have any of these.
PID can cause serious problems if it’s not treated. For example, you might have trouble getting pregnant or have pain in your pelvic area that doesn’t go away.
In some cases, PID can bring on more intense symptoms. You’ll need to go to the emergency room right away if you have:

Some of these also can be signs of other serious medical conditions, like appendicitis or an ectopic pregnancy (a pregnancy that happens in a fallopian tube outside the womb). You would need medical help right away for these as well.
bullets: Pain in your lower belly and pelvis
Heavy discharge from your vagina with an unpleasant odor
Pain when you pee or a hard time going
Severe pain in your lower belly

They include the uterus, ovaries , fallopian tubes, pelvic and abdominal cavities, and cervix . It’s usually caused by a sexually transmitted infection (STI), like chlamydia or gonorrhea , and is treated with antibiotics .
You might not notice any symptoms of PID early on. But as the infection gets worse, you can have:
associated_bullets: Pain in your lower belly and pelvis
Heavy discharge from your vagina with an unpleasant odor
Pain when you pee or a hard time going

content_blocks.text: Call your doctor right away if you have any of these.
PID can cause serious problems if it’s not treated. For example, you might have trouble getting pregnant or have pain in your pelvic area that doesn’t go away.
In some cases, PID can bring on more intense symptoms. You’ll need to go to the emergency room right away if you have:
associated_bullets: Severe pain in your lower belly

content_blocks.text: Some of these also can be signs of other serious medical conditions, like appendicitis or an ectopic pregnancy (a pregnancy that happens in a fallopian tube outside the womb). You would need medical help right away for these as well.

sections.heading: Signs of an STI
content: Treating a sexually transmitted infection right away can help keep you from getting PID. Symptoms of STI are a lot like those of PID. They include heavy discharge from your vagina with an unpleasant odor, pain when you pee, and bleeding between periods.
Call your doctor as soon as you notice any of these to lower your chances of PID.

sources: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists: “Pelvic Inflammatory Disease.”
Mayo Clinic: “Diseases and Conditions: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID).”
meta_description: Pelvic inflammatory disease can cause serious problems if it’s not treated. Find out about symptoms you should look for, when to call your doctor, and when to get emergency treatment.
